descript.abstract: These data represent roads as lines in Grenada (edge of pavement) and St. Vincent and the Grenadines (center line). Roads for the country of Grenada were digitized from WorldView2 2010 orthophotos. Digitization was limited to the 10 meter elevation contour. A few of the smaller roads were not digitized near the coast. This may be a project to complete at a later date. SVG roads were digitzed from 2007 aerial photos, provided by the Physiscal Planning Department (Dornett Hull).
descript.purpose: These data were created under the direction of The Nature Conservancy for the Ecosystem Based Adaptation in the Grenadine Bank project. This project is built on the hypothesis that the neighboring and ecologically connected small island states in the Grenadine Bank can enhance the resilience of people and nature to climate change impacts by protecting, restoring and sustainably managing marine and coastal systems and strengthening community capacity for adaptation.

idinfo.datacred: Completed 15 March 2012. Digitized by Teresa Gomez and Ryan Flake of BYU under contract with the Nature Conservancy. Contact Conservation Information Manager, caribgis@tnc.org.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.3.3600

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Specifies whether the road is paved (coded as 1) or not (coded as 0).
Specifies whether the road is unpaved (coded as 1) or not (coded as 0).
Specifies whether the road is private (coded as 1) or not (coded as 0).
